channel.title: Automation on ZAP
channel.description: Recent content in Automation on ZAP

item.title: Configuring Scan Policies with Alert Tags
item.description: A new feature in ZAP’s automation framework allows you to configure scan policies using alert tags, making it easier to target specific types of vulnerabilities without manually managing individual scan rules.

item.title: Use ZAP with Flagger in Kubernetes
item.description: Learn how to integrate ZAP with Flagger in a Kubernetes cluster to scan the security of each new deployment.

item.title: Powering Up DAST with ZAP and Noir
item.description: Integrating Noir, a tool for discovering hidden endpoints in source code, with ZAP enhances dynamic application security testing (DAST).

item.title: Signing Requests using RSA Keys
item.description: A new script in the community-scripts repository enables the signing of outgoing requests with RSA keys, addressing the challenge of testing applications that require this functionality.

item.title: Automated ZAP Scans for Orchard Core Apps
item.description: If you have an app running on the ASP.NET Core web framework and CMS Orchard Core, you can now easily run ZAP scans for it.

item.title: Automation Guide - Exploring Your App
item.description: ZAP cannot attack parts of the target app if it does not know about them. Exploring the app is key - the more effectively that is done the more effectively ZAP will be able to attack it. This is why ZAP has so many options for exploring apps.

item.title: Automation Guide - Options
item.description:
If you want to use ZAP for automated security scanning then you have a wide range of options, also listed on the main Automate page.

Also see the ZAP Chat 06 Automation Introduction video which talks about and demonstrates all of these options in more detail.

Each of these options provides a different balance between ease of use and flexibility + functionality:

item.title: Automation Guide - Target Scanning Issues
item.description:
It is not unusual for target systems to struggle or even fail when being scanned by ZAP.

This page explains what can go wrong, how to detect these problems and what can be done about them.

Cannot Connect

If ZAP cannot connect to the target app then it will typically fail very quickly. Solving connection problems will depend on the underlying cause, which ZAP will not be able to detect.
